meanings.definition: A device for connecting pieces of equipment that cannot be connected directly.
meanings.sent1: The adaptors helped link the old printer to the new computer.
meanings.sent2: I needed an adaptor to connect the European charger to the American outlet.
meanings.sent3: The adaptors threw a party where all the cables could finally meet and mingle.
meanings.sent4: The adaptors acted as matchmakers, bringing together devices that were meant to be.
meanings.sent5: The adaptors were like magical bridges, uniting different technologies effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A person who adapts to new conditions or situations.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother is a true adaptors, always finding ways to enjoy life no matter what.
meanings.sent2: The adaptors in the group quickly adjusted to the unexpected change in plans.
meanings.sent3: The adaptors at the office decided to have a picnic in the meeting room when it rained outside.
meanings.sent4: She was a chameleon, the ultimate adaptors blending in wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The adaptors shone brightly in the face of challenges, inspiring others with their resilience.
